conditions.name: Elevated Transaminases (Moderate)
conditions.description: ALT or AST levels are greater than 3 times but less than or equal to 5 times the upper limit of normal.
conditions.text: ALT or AST > 3 to <= 5 x ULN

conditions.name: Elevated Transaminases (Severe)
conditions.description: ALT or AST levels are greater than 5 times the upper limit of normal.

conditions.name: Hy's Law Criteria
conditions.description: Bilirubin is elevated above 2x ULN accompanied by ALT elevation above 3x ULN.
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 x ULN Accompanied by ALT > 3 x ULN

conditions.name: Hemoglobin Decrease
conditions.description: Hemoglobin is less than or equal to 10 g/dL or has decreased by more than 20% from baseline.
conditions.text: Hemoglobin <= 10 g/dL or > 20% decrease from baseline

conditions.name: Platelet Decrease
conditions.description: Platelets are less than 100,000/mm3 or have decreased by more than 30% from baseline.

conditions.name: Neutrophil Decrease
conditions.description: Neutrophils have decreased by more than 30% from baseline and are below the reference range.
conditions.text: > 30% decrease from baseline and Neutrophils below reference range

conditions.name: Neurologic Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening.
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening which may include but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis.

conditions.name: Safety Review for Titration
conditions.description: Safety Review Committee (SRC) must review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant before titration.
conditions.text: SRC will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant.

conditions.name: Outpatient Period Extension
conditions.description: The Outpatient Period may be extended with Investigator approval.
conditions.text: The Outpatient Period during Treatment Period 1 may be extended up to an additional 14 days with Investigator approval.

conditions.name: Maximum Rechallenges
conditions.description: A maximum of 3 rechallenges will be allowed after dose interruption.
conditions.text: A maximum of 3 rechallenges will be allowed.

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration to 30 mg/day
transitionRules.text: On Day 29, participants will be titrated up to 30 mg/day, pending a satisfactory safety review by the SRC of data through Day 23.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Moderate Transaminase Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT or AST > 3 to <= 5 x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing. Rechallenge at 15 mg QOD when ALT/AST is < 2 x ULN.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Severe Transaminase Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT or AST > 5 x ULN, discontinue study intervention.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Hematologic Toxicity
transitionRules.text: If hemoglobin, platelet, or neutrophil criteria are met, reduce dose to previous dose level or to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Liver Injury
transitionRules.text: If Bilirubin > 2x ULN with ALT > 3x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing. Rechallenge requires approval of the Alexion Medical Monitor.

transitionRules.name: Dose Modification for Neurologic or Psychiatric Worsening
transitionRules.text: If neurologic or psychiatric worsening occurs, Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification (interruption, increase or decrease).

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Serious Hypersensitivity
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for a serious hypersensitivity reaction.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Severe Infection
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for a severe uncontrolled infection.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Pregnancy
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Disallowed Medication
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for use of disallowed medication.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Withdrawal of Consent
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Discretionary Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted after documented attempts.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Sponsor Termination of Study
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Alexion reserves the right to terminate the study at any time for any reason at the sole discretion of Alexion.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Titration Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point for titrating dose from 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day based on SRC review of safety data.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Modification Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Ongoing decision points to modify, interrupt, or discontinue dosing based on safety monitoring parameters.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Outpatient Period Extension Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Adaptive design feature allowing the Investigator to extend the outpatient period by up to 14 days.
